content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

###Iron Plate Production Line at (-73.0)
Consists of two stone furnaces for smelting iron ore:
- First stone furnace at position (3.0, -73.0)
- Second stone furnace at position (5.0, -73.0)
Both furnaces are operational with coal as fuel but currently have no ingredients to smelt
- First furnace: 27 coal units as fuel
- Second furnace: 23 coal units as fuel

###Copper Mining and Smelting Setup at (-73.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill positioned at (-21.0, -73.0) targeting copper ore deposit
- Stone furnace at (-19.0, -74.0)
- Iron chest at (-21.5, -74.5) to collect copper ore from drill
- Burner inserter at (-20.5, -74.5) moving items from chest to furnace
Current status:
- Mining drill is out of fuel
- Furnace has 7 coal units as fuel and 63 copper plates
- Inserter has 17 coal units as fuel

###Iron Mining and Smelting Setup at (-76.0)
Consists of:
- Burner mining drill positioned at (-2.0, -76.0) targeting iron ore deposit (facing DOWN)
- Iron chest at (-1.5, -74.5) to collect iron ore from drill
- Stone furnace at (0.0, -77.0)
- Burner inserter at (0.5, -78.5) to move iron ore from chest to furnace
Current status:
- Mining drill has 28 coal units as fuel
- Furnace has 50 coal units as fuel
- Chest contains 64 iron ore
- Inserter has 19 coal units as fuel

ERROR TIPS

###Entity Placement Spacing Issues
- When placing a furnace near a mining drill, ensure there is adequate clear space at the drop position
- Check if the target location for furnace placement is actually empty and accessible
- Consider the tile dimensions of both the mining drill (2x2) and furnace (2x2) when planning placement

###Inventory Management
- Always check inventory before attempting to insert items
- Ensure you have the required items (like coal) before attempting insertion operations
- Verify you have the necessary items in inventory before attempting to use them in any operation

###Inserter Setup Issues
- Ensure inserter drop position aligns with the input tile of target furnace
- When repositioning inserters, clean up misplaced ones before placing new ones
- Verify the drop position matches the actual input location of the target entity

###Output Blocking Issues
- Monitor furnace output capacity and collect products regularly to prevent blocking
- Ensure there is a proper output collection system in place when setting up automated production lines
- Set up additional storage or transport systems when furnace output is likely to fill up

###Mining Drill Output Issues
- When setting up mining drills, ensure there is a proper output collection system
- If there's no sink entity to accept output, items will block on the ground
- Verify the mining drill's drop position connects properly to the intended destination

###Low Fuel Monitoring
- Monitor fuel levels in mining drills and inserters regularly
- Replenish fuel before it runs out (copper mining drill is currently out of fuel)
- Maintain adequate fuel levels in all powered entities to ensure continuous operation

###Furnace Fuel Management
- Check furnace fuel capacity before attempting to add more fuel
- Current issue: Attempting to insert coal into a furnace that already has maximum fuel (50/50)
- Monitor fuel levels and only refuel when there is available capacity
